channel.title: Comments on: Making-of: the map of congress equality

item.title: By: oscar6echo
item.dc:creator: oscar6echo
item.description: In case it is still relevant. You can get a shape file a country' administrative areas from http://www.gadm.org/country. For France, at least, it very accurately gives 5 (!) admin levels (region, departement, and then I don't know...) You can then simplify (if necessary) it using mapshaper.com/test/MapShaper.swf (~80% reduction is hardly visible), and turn it to a geoJSON/totpoJSON file with ogr2ogr (cf http://bost.ocks.org/mike/map/). Hope this helps.
item.content:encoded:
In case it is still relevant.
You can get a shape file a country’ administrative areas from http://www.gadm.org/country. For France, at least, it very accurately gives 5 (!) admin levels (region, departement, and then I don’t know…) You can then simplify (if necessary) it using mapshaper.com/test/MapShaper.swf (~80% reduction is hardly visible), and turn it to a geoJSON/totpoJSON file with ogr2ogr (cf http://bost.ocks.org/mike/map/).
Hope this helps.
